Class AllowedWords

  • java.lang.Object
    • AllowedWords

  • public class AllowedWords
extends java.lang.Object
    Class for querying a de-id model on whether any given word is allowed Built using Greg's strategy (see the AMIA 2016 abstract) Created by gpfinley on 9/26/16.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      AllowedWords(java.util.Set<java.lang.String> allowed, java.util.Set<java.lang.String> forbidden, java.util.Set<java.lang.String> alwaysKeep)
      Constructor for various spins on generating a list of allowed words

    • Constructor Detail

      • AllowedWords

        public AllowedWords(@Nullable
                    java.util.Set<java.lang.String> allowed,
                    @Nullable
                    java.util.Set<java.lang.String> forbidden,
                    @Nullable
                    java.util.Set<java.lang.String> alwaysKeep)
        Constructor for various spins on generating a list of allowed words
        Parameters:
        allowed - words to allow (leave null if any non-forbidden words are allowed)
        forbidden - words to not allow (leave null if all allowed words should be allowed)
        alwaysKeep - words to keep even if they are 'forbidden', e.g. very common words (leave null to not use)

    • Method Detail

      • isAllowed

        public boolean isAllowed(java.lang.String word)
        Determine if a word is allowed under this de-id scheme.
        Parameters:
        word - any string. Case distinctions will be collapsed.
        Returns:
        true if the word is not an identifier, false if it needs to be scrubbed

      • save

        public void save(java.lang.String outPath)
          throws java.io.IOException
        Save this object to a text file using a simple human-readable output.
        Parameters:
        outPath - where to save the file
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • load

        public static AllowedWords load(java.lang.String inPath)
                         throws java.io.IOException
        Load an instance of this object from a text file.
        Parameters:
        inPath - path of the text output. Should have first line devoted to strategy (allowed vs. forbidden words)
        Returns:
        a new AllowedWords object
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • getAllowedWordsFromSpecialist

        public static java.util.Set<java.lang.String> getAllowedWordsFromSpecialist(java.lang.String specialistPath)
                                                                     throws java.io.IOException
        Get words from SPECIALIST to use as the first argument to the constructor.
        Parameters:
        specialistPath - the location of the LEXICON file
        Returns:
        a set of words to allow
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • getForbiddenWordsFromNamesAddresses

        public static java.util.Set<java.lang.String> getForbiddenWordsFromNamesAddresses(java.lang.String namesAddressesPath)
                                                                           throws java.io.IOException
        Get words from a database of names and addresses (or any file), probably as second argument to constructor.
        Parameters:
        namesAddressesPath - a file containing personal identifiers of all patients
        Returns:
        a set of words to forbid
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • getMostFrequentWords

        public static java.util.Set<java.lang.String> getMostFrequentWords(java.lang.String vocabPath,
                                                                   int n)
                                                            throws java.io.IOException
        Get a set of the most frequent words (probably to pass as third argument to constructor).
        Parameters:
        vocabPath - path of the word2vec-style vocabulary (one word per line, possibly w/ space afterward)
        n - the number of top words to take
        Returns:
        a set of words to keep no matter what
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
                 throws java.io.IOException
        Generate and save an AllowedWords model from various sources.
        Parameters:
        args - 1: path of LEXICON file from SPECIALIST - 2: path of names/addresses database text dump - 3: path of word2vec-style vocab file for determining most common words - 4: number of most common words to keep - 5: output path for the AllowedWords object
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
